Text.Value: *You feel the creature's thoughts stumble against your magic, your will to resist...*
*You can't move, can't think: thinking is mercifully done for you.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: [REUSE] MFL: dying idle, on the ground, tentacles twitching [CodyM]
EditorData.NodeContext: The mind flayer has you under its control now, you earnestly mean this line.

Text.Value: This isn't right. Step away.
Concentrate on its thoughts.
Resist the intrusion with everything you have.
*You approach the dying monster. This is the thing that abducted you.*

EditorData.NodeContext: On guard

Text.Value: *Its mind grips your own like a vice. You feel it locking you into obedience.*
No. It's fine. Everything will be fine...
*But then the feeling slips. The creature's mind seems to focus elsewhere.*

EditorData.NodeContext: With a bit of relief that the mind flayer's focus on you is abating.

Text.Value: Give in to the emotion.

EditorData.AnimationTags: From a standing position, the player gets onto all fours and leans in to the Mindflayer, as if for a kiss. Mindflayer is laying on its right side.
[Beau] The player manages to resist the Mindflayer's influence, suddenly realising the danger they were in and comes to a standing position.

Text.Value: No. You should be furious... shouldn't you?
*It will be a joy to serve - to die for it an honour!*

EditorData.NodeContext: The mind flayer has you under its control now, you earnestly mean this line.

Text.Value: *... you're perfectly happy.*

EditorData.NodeContext: With wonder. You feel glorious. Your life is complete.

Text.Value: Whoa - what  in the hells are you doing?!

EditorData.NodeContext: Incredulous/ urgent

Text.Value: Change your mind. Resist, if you still can.
K'chakhi - back. You must resist its call!
*You'd give your life to save it, to nurse it back to health!*

EditorData.NodeContext: The mind flayer has you under its control now, you earnestly mean this line.

Text.Value: What are you... no, no! You have to fight it!
*The monster's tentacles twitch weakly. It won't last much longer.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: MFL: dying idle, on the ground, tentacles twitching [CodyM]
EditorData.NodeContext: With satisfaction

Text.Value: *Compassion?*

EditorData.NodeContext: Bewildered. That was the last emotion you were expecting.

Text.Value: *Compassion.*

EditorData.NodeContext: With warmth

Text.Value: Submit to the feeling - lean in, as for a kiss...
*Yes, you feel hate. And you deserve to be punished for it.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: [REUSE] MFL: dying idle, on the ground, tentacles twitching [CodyM]
EditorData.NodeContext: The mind flayer has you under its control now, you earnestly mean this line.

Text.Value: *Your willpower is not enough. The creature's mind slaps away your efforts to resist it.*
Leave it to die - slowly.

EditorData.NodeContext: With relish

Text.Value: *It needs sustenance to survive, and with your very body you can provide.*

EditorData.NodeContext: You're being enthralled again. Giving up yourself up as food sounds like a sensible idea.

Text.Value: *You could end its life here and now, if only you didn't feel...*

EditorData.NodeContext: Hesitant

Text.Value: *Warm, wet tentacles wrap themselves around your head, and for the first time in your life...*

EditorData.AnimationTags: PLAYER gets on their knees, PLAYER on knees idle (for question node), MFL wraps tentacles around PLAYER head and feasts, [CodyM]
EditorData.NodeContext: Accepting. This is a good, wonderful thing.

Text.Value: *You should be whipped - made to bow before this creature in shame!*

EditorData.NodeContext: The mind flayer has you under its control now, you earnestly mean this line.

Text.Value: *But then its grip claws back with a vengeance: a vice locking your mind into obedience.*

EditorData.NodeContext: Intense

Text.Value: *You try to break through, but its mind is impenetrable. With a last surge of defiance, it slaps your efforts away.*
*Your minds fuse, lusting for something that is... gone.*

EditorData.NodeContext: Mysterious. What is it? What is gone?

Text.Value: Get away from that thing!

EditorData.NodeContext: Alarm - her companion's at risk of becoming enthralled by a mind flayer

Text.Value: You host the blood of a mighty dragon. Channel its will to resist the abomination.
Steel your will and allow your untamed magic to unbalance the creature's mind.
Draw on your willpower. Improvise a mental shield against the creature's hungry mind.
What are you doing? Stand back! Now!

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Beau] The mindflayer extends its tentacles to wrap around the player's face and head and feasts. The player doesn't resist and falls to the ground, dead.

Text.Value: Close those eyes forever.

EditorData.NodeContext: With relish

Text.Value: What in the hells - get away from that thing!

EditorData.NodeContext: Asking "What in the hells are you doing?" - realises halfway through the line that you're going to kiss a mind flayer

Text.Value: *You approach the dying ghaik. The foul thing is at your mercy, and you would have its head.*

EditorData.NodeContext: ghaik is 'gayk' the githyanki word for a mind flayer - this line is only spoken by githyanki characters

Text.Value: Take advantage of the lapse - break free.
*It's possessing your mind, forcing you to... love it.*

EditorData.NodeContext: With a hint of desperation

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Beau] The player manages to resist the Mindflayer's influence, suddenly realising the danger they were in and comes to a standing position.

Text.Value: *The poor creature is on the brink of death, but there's still time.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: [REUSE] MFL: dying idle, on the ground, tentacles twitching [CodyM]
EditorData.NodeContext: The mind flayer has you under its control now, you earnestly mean this line.

Text.Value: *The monster lies exhausted, defeated. Its eyes - wet, orange pearls - radiate malice.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: If PLAYER was kneeling, they stand stand up after resisting the MFL's intrusion. (will need a node to cover this) [CodyM]
EditorData.NodeContext: Victorious

Synopsis: The player approaches the dying mind flayer. During the dialog the player describes how the mind flayer still tries to telepathically dominate him or her into feeling compassion for the creature. In the end the player can give in to the mind flayer (which results in death) or resist.
